name: Stralis Aircraft
headline: Emission free hydrogen electric aircraft
description: Our planes fly 10 times further than battery electric alternatives, with a lower operating cost than fossil fuel powered aircraft. Our first product is a 15 seat aircraft with a range of 800 km that enters service in 2026 with launch customer Skytrans. Our team has over 85 years of aerospace experience and have developed, flight tested and certified aircraft at Google X, magniX, Heart Aerospace, Ampaire, Airbus, Boeing, Bombardier and Gulfstream. We have $145M in aircraft LOIs from 7 airlines in the US, Europe and Australia.

founders.name: Bob Criner, Founder
founders.description: Bob is Co-Founder & CEO of Stralis Aircraft, where he uses his extensive international aerospace experience to drive company strategy and aircraft product development. He previously supported leading emission free aircraft projects at Heart Aerospace, Ampaire, magniX and Google X, combining a strong passion for sustainability with technical engineering skills. Born in Nashville, TN, he moved to Australia at 10 and studied Aerospace Engineering at UNSW in Sydney.

founders.name: Stuart Johnstone, Founder
founders.description: Stuart is co-founder and CTO at Stralis Aircraft and is leading the development of their lightweight hydrogen electric propulsion system. Stuart started his career in engineering working on superconducting magnets for MRI and scientific applications. This multidisciplinary experience along with an MSci in Physics from University of Glasgow gave him the tools to tackle novel and interesting engineering problems that can impact the planet for the better.

Long-range hydrogen-electric propulsion systems
Our patent-pending fuel cell technology is 6x lighter than the current state of the art, unlocking hydrogen-electric aircraft that can fly 10x further than battery-electric alternatives and are 50% cheaper to operate than fossil fuel-powered aircraft.
[Why Hydrogen ›](https://stralis.aero/</why>)
While our technology is optimised for commercial aircraft, our sustainable, economical, and scalable solution can also power long-range drones or operate heavy duty vehicles in harsh environments.
[Meet the team ›](https://stralis.aero/</company>)

generated_description:
### Stralis Aircraft: Pioneering Hydrogen-Electric Aviation

**Overview**  
Founded in 2021 and currently part of Y Combinator Batch W23, Stralis Aircraft is on a mission to revolutionize the aviation industry with emission-free hydrogen-electric aircraft. The company is based in Brisbane, Australia, and comprises a compact but experienced team of four members—together boasting over 85 years of aerospace experience from leading organizations like Google X, Airbus, and Boeing.

**Mission**  
Stralis Aircraft aims to create sustainable air travel solutions by significantly reducing carbon emissions. Their pioneering hydrogen-electric propulsion technology allows their aircraft to fly ten times further than traditional battery-electric counterparts, all while operating at 50% lower costs compared to fossil fuel-powered aircraft. 

**The Product**  
The company’s first offering is a 15-seat aircraft with an impressive range of 800 km, set to enter service in 2026 with launch customer Skytrans. They also have a roadmap for solutions that could extend beyond passenger aircraft, potentially powering long-range drones and heavy-duty vehicles in challenging environments.

**Market Position**  
Stralis Aircraft has secured an impressive $145 million in Letters of Intent (LOIs) from seven airlines across the U.S., Europe, and Australia—a strong validation of market interest and potential demand. Their innovation in fuel cell technology—which is six times lighter than existing alternatives—positions them at the forefront of the emerging hydrogen aviation market.

**Community and Networks**  
The company is part of the Hydrogen Flight Alliance, highlighting its commitment to forming partnerships and collaborating with industry leaders to accelerate the adoption of sustainable aviation technologies.

**For More Information**  
For those interested in following their journey or learning more about their technological advancements, Stralis has an engaging website at [stralis.aero](https://stralis.aero/). Here, visitors can subscribe for updates, explore why hydrogen is a game-changer for aviation, and view their product offerings.

### Key Tags
- **Hard Tech**
- **Hydrogen Energy**
- **Airplanes**
- **Climate Action**
- **Electric Vehicles**

### Leadership  
Aaron Epstein serves as the Group Partner, guiding Stralis as it pioneers this critical transformation in aviation.

In summary, Stralis Aircraft is not just building planes; it's sculpting the future of how we think about air travel—efficient, sustainable, and dramatically cleaner. If you're passionate about the intersection of aerospace and environmental sustainability, keep an eye on Stralis; they could very well lead the charge into a new era of aviation.
